intro: Hieracium trebevicianum subsp. pseudobifidum, commonly known as the False Two-lobed Hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a cluster of small flowers. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, thriving in temperate climates. Its leaves are basal, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow and arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence. This subspecies is distinguished by its unique leaf morphology and habitat preferences.
